<li id="cite_note-486"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-486">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFBanerjea2004">Banerjea, JN (September 2004). <i>The Development of Hindu Iconography</i>. <li id="cite_note-Radhakrishnan-488"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Radhakrishnan_488-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFRadhakrishnan1929"><a href="/wiki/Sarvepalli_Radhakrishnan" title="Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan">Radhakrishnan, S.</a> (1929). <i>Indian Philosophy, Volume 1</i>. <li id="cite_note-489"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-489">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">For <i><span title="International Alphabet of Sanskrit transliteration"><i lang="sa-Latn">ahiṃsā</i></span></i> as one of the "emerging ethical and religious issues" in the <span title="International Alphabet of Sanskrit transliteration"><i lang="sa-Latn"><a href="/wiki/Mahabharata" title="Mahabharata">Mahābhārata</a></i></span> see: <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFBrockington2003">Brockington, John (2003). "The Sanskrit Epics". <i>Flood</i>. p. 125.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=The+Sanskrit+Epics&amp;rft.btitle=Flood&amp;rft.pages=125&amp;rft.date=2003&amp;rft.aulast=Brockington&amp;rft.aufirst=John&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AHinduism"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-490"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-490">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">For text of Y.S. 2.29 and translation of <i><span title="International Alphabet of Sanskrit transliteration"><i lang="sa-Latn">yama</i></span></i> as "vow of self-restraint", see: <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFTaimni1961"><a href="/wiki/I._K._Taimni" title="I. K. Taimni">Taimni, I. K.</a> (1961). <i>The Science of Yoga</i>. Adyar, India: The Theosophical Publishing House. p. 206. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-81-7059-212-9" title="Special:BookSources/978-81-7059-212-9"><bdi>978-81-7059-212-9</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Science+of+Yoga&amp;rft.place=Adyar%2C+India&amp;rft.pages=206&amp;rft.pub=The+Theosophical+Publishing+House&amp;rft.date=1961&amp;rft.isbn=978-81-7059-212-9&amp;rft.aulast=Taimni&amp;rft.aufirst=I.+K.&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AHinduism"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-veg-491"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-veg_491-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Surveys studying food habits of Indians include:
<ul><li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1">Delgado, Christopher L.; Narrod, Claire A.; Tiongco, Marites (24 July 2003). <a class="external text" href="http://www.fao.org/3/x6170e09.htm" rel="nofollow">"Growth and Concentration in India"</a>. <i>Policy, Technical, and Environmental Determinants and Implications of the Scaling-Up of Livestock Production in Four Fast-Growing Developing Countries: A Synthesis</i>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20201229174129/http://www.fao.org/3/x6170e09.htm" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 29 December 2020<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">29 December</span> 2020</span>. <q>An analysis of consumption data originating from National Sample Survey (NSS) shows that 42 percent of households are vegetarian, in that they never eat fish, meat or eggs. The remaining 58 percent of households are less strict vegetarians or non-vegetarians.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Policy%2C+Technical%2C+and+Environmental+Determinants+and+Implications+of+the+Scaling-Up+of+Livestock+Production+in+Four+Fast-Growing+Developing+Countries%3A+A+Synthesis&amp;rft.atitle=Growth+and+Concentration+in+India&amp;rft.date=2003-07-24&amp;rft.aulast=Delgado&amp;rft.aufirst=Christopher+L.&amp;rft.au=Narrod%2C+Claire+A.&amp;rft.au=Tiongco%2C+Marites&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.fao.org%2F3%2Fx6170e09.htm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AHinduism"></span></li>
<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1">Goldammer, Ted. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20090619160055/http://www.fas.usda.gov/htp/highlights/2001/india.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Passage to India"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. USDA Foreign Agricultural Service. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://www.fas.usda.gov/htp/highlights/2001/india.pdf" rel="nofollow">the original</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> on 19 June 2009.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Passage+to+India&amp;rft.pub=USDA+Foreign+Agricultural+Service&amp;rft.aulast=Goldammer&amp;rft.aufirst=Ted&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.fas.usda.gov%2Fhtp%2Fhighlights%2F2001%2Findia.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AHinduism"></span></li>
<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1">Landes, Maurice R. (February 2004). <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20061228214808/http://www.ers.usda.gov/amberwaves/february04/features/elephantjogs.htm" rel="nofollow">"The Elephant Is Jogging: New Pressures for Agricultural Reform in India"</a>. <i>Amber Waves</i>. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://www.ers.usda.gov/amberwaves/February04/Features/ElephantJogs.htm" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on 28 December 2006. <q>Results indicate that Indians who eat meat do so infrequently with less than 30% consuming non-vegetarian foods regularly, although the reasons may be economical.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Amber+Waves&amp;rft.atitle=The+Elephant+Is+Jogging%3A+New+Pressures+for+Agricultural+Reform+in+India&amp;rft.date=2004-02&amp;rft.aulast=Landes&amp;rft.aufirst=Maurice+R.&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.ers.usda.gov%2Famberwaves%2FFebruary04%2FFeatures%2FElephantJogs.htm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AHinduism"></span></li></ul>
</span></li>

<li id="cite_note-496"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-496">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFUttara_Kennedy,_Arvind_Sharma_and_Clive_J.C._Philips2018">Uttara Kennedy, Arvind Sharma and Clive J.C. <li id="cite_note-497"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-497">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFMarvin_Harris">Marvin Harris. <a class="external text" href="http://spraakdata.gu.se/taraka/SacredCow.pdf" rel="nofollow"><i>India's scared cow</i></a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=India%27s+scared+cow&amp;rft.au=Marvin+Harris&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fspraakdata.gu.se%2Ftaraka%2FSacredCow.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AHinduism"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-498"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-498">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFDr_Gloria_Pungetti,_Dr_Anna_Maclvor">Dr Gloria Pungetti, Dr Anna Maclvor. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20210724135557/https://www.iucn.org/sites/dev/files/import/downloads/preliminary_literature_review_on_sacred_species__3_.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Preliminary Literature Review On Scared Species"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTERichman1988272-500"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTERichman1988272_500-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFRichman1988">Richman 1988</a>, p. 272.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-ajai16P_pg62-501"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-ajai16P_pg62_501-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFMansingh2016">Mansingh, Ajai (2016). <a class="external text" href="https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/abs/10.1080/00086495.1995.11672075" rel="nofollow">"Stewards of Creation Covenant: Hinduism and the Environment"</a>. <i>Caribbean Quarterly</i>. </li>

<li id="cite_note-511"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-511">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFYayasan2005">Yayasan, Bumi Kita (30 September 2005). <a class="external text" href="http://bookshop.blackwell.co.uk/jsp/welcome.jsp?action=search&amp;type=isbn&amp;term=9793780002" rel="nofollow">"The Hidden Life of Bali"</a>. </li>
<li id="cite_note-512"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-512">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFGwynne2011">Gwynne, Paul (2011). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=tdsRKc_knZoC&amp;pg=RA5-PT75" rel="nofollow"><i>World Religions in Practice: A Comparative Introduction</i></a>. John Wiley &amp; Sons. p. 5 footnote 16. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-4443-6005-9" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-4443-6005-9"><bdi>978-1-4443-6005-9</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=World+Religions+in+Practice%3A+A+Comparative+Introduction&amp;rft.pages=5+footnote+16&amp;rft.pub=John+Wiley+%26+Sons&amp;rft.date=2011&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-4443-6005-9&amp;rft.aulast=Gwynne&amp;rft.aufirst=Paul&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DtdsRKc_knZoC%26pg%3DRA5-PT75&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AHinduism"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-513"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-513">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFOlcott1906">Olcott, H.S. (1906). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=jKBVAAAAYAAJ&amp;pg=PA146" rel="nofollow"><i>The Theosophist</i></a>. Vol. XXVII. Theosophical Publishing House. pp. 146 with footnote.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Theosophist&amp;rft.pages=146+with+footnote&amp;rft.pub=Theosophical+Publishing+House&amp;rft.date=1906&amp;rft.aulast=Olcott&amp;rft.aufirst=H.S.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DjKBVAAAAYAAJ%26pg%3DPA146&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AHinduism"></span>, Quote: "It is well known that Vaishnavas abhor animal sacrifice. In this province, like nearly all Bengalis, they celebrate <a href="/wiki/Durga_Puja" title="Durga Puja">Durga Puja</a>, but their ceremonies are bloodless".</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTEFuller2004101–102,_Quote:_&quot;Blood_sacrifice_was_a_clear_case_in_point,_(,_,_,_)_sacrifice_was_a_barbarity_inconsistent_with_Hinduism's_central_tenet_of_non-violence._[...]_Contemporary_opposition_to_animal_sacrifice_rests_on_an_old_foundation,_although_it_also_stems_from_the_very_widespread_influence_of_reformism,_whose_antipathy_to_ritual_killing_has_spread_well_beyond_the_self-consciously_nationalist_political_classes&quot;.-514"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEFuller2004101–102,_Quote:_&quot;Blood_sacrifice_was_a_clear_case_in_point,_(,_,_,_)_sacrifice_was_a_barbarity_inconsistent_with_Hinduism's_central_tenet_of_non-violence._[...]_Contemporary_opposition_to_animal_sacrifice_rests_on_an_old_foundation,_although_it_also_stems_from_the_very_widespread_influence_of_reformism,_whose_antipathy_to_ritual_killing_has_spread_well_beyond_the_self-consciously_nationalist_political_classes&quot;._514-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFFuller2004">Fuller 2004</a>, pp. 101–102, Quote: "Blood sacrifice was a clear case in point, (, , , ) sacrifice was a barbarity inconsistent with Hinduism's central tenet of non-violence. [...] Contemporary opposition to animal sacrifice rests on an old foundation, although it also stems from the very widespread influence of reformism, whose antipathy to ritual killing has spread well beyond the self-consciously nationalist political classes"..</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-515"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-515">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFNicholson2010">Nicholson 2010</a>, p. 169, Quote: "The acceptance of the principle of non-violence has been so through that animal sacrifice among Hindus today is uncommon, and many <a href="/wiki/India" title="India">Indians</a> are of the opinion that such things as cow slaughter were never practiced in <a href="/wiki/History_of_India" title="History of India">ancient India</a>".</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-516"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-516">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFBekoff2009">Bekoff, Marc (2009). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=AmgYIBQ-XKkC&amp;pg=PA482" rel="nofollow"><i>Encyclopedia of Animal Rights and Animal Welfare, 2nd Edition</i></a>. ABC-CLIO. p. 482. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-313-35256-0" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-313-35256-0"><bdi>978-0-313-35256-0</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Encyclopedia+of+Animal+Rights+and+Animal+Welfare%2C+2nd+Edition&amp;rft.pages=482&amp;rft.pub=ABC-CLIO&amp;rft.date=2009&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-313-35256-0&amp;rft.aulast=Bekoff&amp;rft.aufirst=Marc&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DAmgYIBQ-XKkC%26pg%3DPA482&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AHinduism"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTEMichell198861–65-517"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEMichell198861–65_517-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFMichell1988">Michell 1988</a>, pp. 61–65.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-stellakvol1-518"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-stellakvol1_518-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-stellakvol1_518-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-stellakvol1_518-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-stellakvol1_518-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFKramrisch1976a">Kramrisch 1976a</a>, pp. 1–16</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTEKramrisch1976a161–169-519"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEKramrisch1976a161–169_519-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFKramrisch1976a">Kramrisch 1976a</a>, pp. 161–169.</span>

<li id="cite_note-2010_census_Full_report-588"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-2010_census_Full_report_588-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFSingapore_Department_of_Statistics2011">Singapore Department of Statistics (12 January 2011). <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110303155259/http://www.singstat.gov.sg/pubn/popn/C2010sr1/cop2010sr1.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Census of population 2010: Statistical Release 1 on Demographic Characteristics, Education, Language and Religion"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://www.singstat.gov.sg/pubn/popn/C2010sr1/cop2010sr1.pdf" rel="nofollow">the original</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> on 3 March 2011<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">16 January</span> 2011</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Census+of+population+2010%3A+Statistical+Release+1+on+Demographic+Characteristics%2C+Education%2C+Language+and+Religion&amp;rft.date=2011-01-12&amp;rft.au=Singapore+Department+of+Statistics&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.singstat.gov.sg%2Fpubn%2Fpopn%2FC2010sr1%2Fcop2010sr1.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AHinduism"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-589"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-589">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://2009-2017.state.gov/j/drl/rls/irf/2010_5/168356.htm" rel="nofollow">"Indonesia: Religious Freedoms Report 2010"</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/US_State_Department" title="US State Department">US State Department</a>. 2011<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">4 March</span> 2021</span>. <q>The Ministry of Religious Affairs estimates that 10 million Hindus live in the country and account for approximately 90 percent of the population in Bali. Hindu minorities also reside in Central and East Kalimantan, the city of Medan (North Sumatra), South and Central Sulawesi, and Lombok (West Nusa Tenggara). Hindu groups such as Hare Krishna and followers of the Indian spiritual leader Sai Baba are present in small numbers. Some indigenous religious groups, including the "Naurus" on Seram Island in Maluku Province, incorporate Hindu and animist beliefs, and many have also adopted some Protestant teachings.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Indonesia%3A+Religious+Freedoms+Report+2010&amp;rft.pub=US+State+Department&amp;rft.date=2011&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2F2009-2017.state.gov%2Fj%2Fdrl%2Frls%2Firf%2F2010_5%2F168356.htm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AHinduism"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-592"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-592">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20140402081116/http://www.census.gov.pk/Religion.htm" rel="nofollow">"Population by religion in Pakistan"</a>. <li id="cite_note-593"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-593">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20150506113049/http://www.pewforum.org/files/2015/03/PF_15.04.02_ProjectionsFullReport.pdf" rel="nofollow">"The Future of World Religions"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i>Pew Research</i>. 2015. <li id="cite_note-608"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-608">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFLaurenceKumar1987">Laurence, Michael; Kumar, Girish (15 June 1987). <a class="external text" href="https://www.indiatoday.in/magazine/international/story/19870615-lt-colonel-rabuka-throws-out-the-allegedly-indian-bavadra-government-in-fiji-798927-1987-06-15" rel="nofollow">"Lt-Colonel Rabuka throws out the allegedly 'Indian' Bavadra government in Fiji"</a>. <i>India Today</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-625"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-625">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFBarua2015">Barua, Ankur (2015). <li id="cite_note-626"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-626">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFHefner2004"><a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Robert_W._Hefner_Jr.&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Robert W. Hefner Jr. (page does not exist)">Hefner, Robert</a> (2004). "Hindu Reform in an Islamising Java: Pluralism and Peril".  In Ramstedt, Martin (ed.). <a class="external text" href="https://www.routledge.com/Hinduism-in-Modern-Indonesia/Ramstedt/p/book/9780700715336" rel="nofollow"><i>Hinduism in Modern Indonesia: A Minority Religion Between Local, National, and Global Interests</i></a>. New York: Routledge. pp. 93–108. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-7007-1533-6" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-7007-1533-6"><bdi>978-0-7007-1533-6</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Hindu+Reform+in+an+Islamising+Java%3A+Pluralism+and+Peril&amp;rft.btitle=Hinduism+in+Modern+Indonesia%3A+A+Minority+Religion+Between+Local%2C+National%2C+and+Global+Interests&amp;rft.place=New+York&amp;rft.pages=93-108&amp;rft.pub=Routledge&amp;rft.date=2004&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-7007-1533-6&amp;rft.aulast=Hefner&amp;rft.aufirst=Robert&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.routledge.com%2FHinduism-in-Modern-Indonesia%2FRamstedt%2Fp%2Fbook%2F9780700715336&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AHinduism"></span></span>
</li>
</ol></div>

<li id="cite_note-433"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-433">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFTaylor2013">Taylor, Alan (14 January 2013). <a class="external text" href="https://www.theatlantic.com/photo/2013/01/kumbh-mela-the-largest-gathering-on-earth/100438/" rel="nofollow">"Kumbh Mela: The Largest Gathering on Earth"</a>. <i>The Atlantic</i>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20201229174128/https://www.theatlantic.com/photo/2013/01/kumbh-mela-the-largest-gathering-on-earth/100438/" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 29 December 2020<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-469"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-469">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20100528064608/http://www.bergen.edu/phr/121/ManuGC.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Manu Smriti Laws of Manu"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. 1.87–1.91. </li>
<li id="cite_note-474"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-474">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFV">V, Jayaram. <a class="external text" href="http://www.hinduwebsite.com/hinduism/h_caste.asp" rel="nofollow">"The Hindu Caste System"</a>. <i>Hinduwebsite</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">28 November</span> 2012</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Hinduwebsite&amp;rft.atitle=The+Hindu+Caste+System&amp;rft.aulast=V&amp;rft.aufirst=Jayaram&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.hinduwebsite.com%2Fhinduism%2Fh_caste.asp&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AHinduism"></span></span>
</li>

Oneworld Publications. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-78074-026-3" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-78074-026-3"><bdi>978-1-78074-026-3</bdi></a>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20201229174233/https://books.google.com/books?id=P0VCO1900dMC" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 29 December 2020.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Hinduism%3A+A+Beginner%27s+Guide&amp;rft.pub=Oneworld+Publications&amp;rft.date=2007&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-78074-026-3&amp;rft.aulast=Klostermaier&amp;rft.aufirst=Klaus+K.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DP0VCO1900dMC&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AHinduism"></span></li>
<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1">Knott, Kim (1998). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=p4kzNzII3zAC" rel="nofollow"><i>Hinduism: A Very Short Introduction</i></a>. New York: Oxford University Press. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-19-160645-8" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-19-160645-8"><bdi>978-0-19-160645-8</bdi></a>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20201229174324/https://books.google.com/books?id=p4kzNzII3zAC&amp;pg=PA6" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 29 December 2020.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Hinduism%3A+A+Very+Short+Introduction&amp;rft.place=New+York&amp;rft.pub=Oxford+University+Press&amp;rft.date=1998&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-19-160645-8&amp;rft.aulast=Knott&amp;rft.aufirst=Kim&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3Dp4kzNzII3zAC&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AHinduism"></span></li></ul>
<dl><dt>History</dt></dl>
<ul><li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1"><a href="/wiki/D._P._Chattopadhyaya" title="D. P. Chattopadhyaya">Chattopadhyaya, D. P.</a> (ed.). <i><a href="/wiki/Project_of_History_of_Indian_Science,_Philosophy_and_Culture" title="Project of History of Indian Science, Philosophy and Culture">History of Science, Philosophy and Culture in Indian Civilization</a></i>. Vol. 1–15. Delhi: <a href="/wiki/Centre_for_Studies_in_Civilizations" title="Centre for Studies in Civilizations">Centre for Studies in Civilizations</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=History+of+Science%2C+Philosophy+and+Culture+in+Indian+Civilization&amp;rft.place=Delhi&amp;rft.pub=Centre+for+Studies+in+Civilizations&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AHinduism"></span></li>
<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1"><a href="/wiki/Arthur_Llewellyn_Basham" title="Arthur Llewellyn Basham">Basham, Arthur Llewellyn</a> (1954). <i><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/The_Wonder_That_was_India" title="The Wonder That was India">The Wonder That Was India: A Survey of the Culture of the Indian Sub-Continent Before the Coming of the Muslims</a></i>. London: Sidgwick &amp; Jackson.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Wonder+That+Was+India%3A+A+Survey+of+the+Culture+of+the+Indian+Sub-Continent+Before+the+Coming+of+the+Muslims&amp;rft.place=London&amp;rft.pub=Sidgwick+%26+Jackson&amp;rft.date=1954&amp;rft.aulast=Basham&amp;rft.aufirst=Arthur+Llewellyn&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AHinduism"></span></li>
<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1"><a href="/wiki/Asko_Parpola" title="Asko Parpola">Parpola, Asko</a> (2015). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=DagXCgAAQBAJ" rel="nofollow"><i>The Roots of Hinduism. The Early Aryans and the Indus Civilization</i></a>. Oxford University Press. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-19-022693-0" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-19-022693-0"><bdi>978-0-19-022693-0</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Roots+of+Hinduism.+The+Early+Aryans+and+the+Indus+Civilization&amp;rft.pub=Oxford+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2015&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-19-022693-0&amp;rft.aulast=Parpola&amp;rft.aufirst=Asko&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DDagXCgAAQBAJ&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AHinduism"></span></li>
<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1"><a href="/wiki/Geoffrey_Samuel" title="Geoffrey Samuel">Samuel, Geoffrey</a> (2010). <i>The Origins of Yoga and Tantra. Indic Religions to the Thirteenth Century</i>. Cambridge University Press.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Origins+of+Yoga+and+Tantra.+Indic+Religions+to+the+Thirteenth+Century&amp;rft.pub=Cambridge+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2010&amp;rft.aulast=Samuel&amp;rft.aufirst=Geoffrey&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AHinduism"></span></li></ul>
<dl><dt>Philosophy and theology</dt></dl>
<ul><li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1"><a href="/wiki/Surendranath_Dasgupta" title="Surendranath Dasgupta">Dasgupta, Surendranath</a> (1922–1955). <a class="external text" href="https://www.indianculture.gov.in/reports-proceedings/history-indian-philosophy-vol-i" rel="nofollow"><i>A History of Indian Philosophy</i></a>. Vol. 1–5. London: Cambridge University Press.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=A+History+of+Indian+Philosophy&amp;rft.place=London&amp;rft.pub=Cambridge+University+Press&amp;rft.date=1922%2F1955&amp;rft.aulast=Dasgupta&amp;rft.aufirst=Surendranath&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.indianculture.gov.in%2Freports-proceedings%2Fhistory-indian-philosophy-vol-i&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AHinduism"></span> <a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/in.ernet.dli.2015.96713" rel="nofollow">Vol. 1</a> | <a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/in.ernet.dli.2015.57593" rel="nofollow">Vol. 2</a> | <a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/in.ernet.dli.2015.57392" rel="nofollow">Vol. 3</a> | <a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/dli.ernet.231099" rel="nofollow">Vol. 4</a> | <a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/AHistoryOfIndianPhilosophyVol5/page/n1/mode/2up" rel="nofollow">Vol. 5.</a></li>
<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1"><a href="/wiki/Sarvepalli_Radhakrishnan" title="Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan">Radhakrishnan, Sarvepalli</a> (1923–1927). <a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/Sarvepalli.Radhakrishnan.Indian.Philosophy.Volume.1-2" rel="nofollow"><i>Indian Philosophy</i></a>. Vol. 1–2. Oxford: Oxford University Press.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Indian+Philosophy&amp;rft.place=Oxford&amp;rft.pub=Oxford+University+Press&amp;rft.date=1923%2F1927&amp;rft.aulast=Radhakrishnan&amp;rft.aufirst=Sarvepalli&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Farchive.org%2Fdetails%2FSarvepalli.Radhakrishnan.Indian.Philosophy.Volume.1-2&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AHinduism"></span></li></ul>

(eds.). <a class="external text" href="https://referenceworks.brillonline.com/browse/brill-s-encyclopedia-of-hinduism" rel="nofollow"><i>Brill's Encyclopedia of Hinduism Online</i></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Brill%27s+Encyclopedia+of+Hinduism+Online&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Freferenceworks.brillonline.com%2Fbrowse%2Fbrill-s-encyclopedia-of-hinduism&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AHinduism"></span></li>

<li><a class="external text" href="https://www.learnreligions.com/hinduism-4684846" rel="nofollow">Many articles about Hinduism</a> by <i><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Dotdash" title="Dotdash">Dotdash</a></i> (formerly <i>About.com</i>)</li>

<dl><dt>Hindu views</dt></dl>
<ul><li><a class="external text" href="http://www.iep.utm.edu/hindu-ph/" rel="nofollow">Hindu Philosophy and Hinduism</a>, IEP, Shyam Ranganathan, York University</li>
<li><a class="external text" href="http://www.people.fas.harvard.edu/~witzel/vedica.pdf" rel="nofollow">Vedic Hinduism</a> SW Jamison and M Witzel, Harvard University</li>
<li><a class="extiw" href="https://en.wikisource.org/wiki/The_Complete_Works_of_Swami_Vivekananda/Volume_1/Lectures_And_Discourses/The_Hindu_Religion" title="s:The Complete Works of Swami Vivekananda/Volume 1/Lectures And Discourses/The Hindu Religion">The Hindu Religion</a>, Swami Vivekananda (1894), Wikisource</li>
<li><a class="external text" href="http://www.ramakrishna.org/catalog/archive/Spirit_of_Hinduism.htm" rel="nofollow">Hinduism by Swami Nikhilananda</a>, The Ramakrishna Mission (one of the Theistic Hindu Movements)</li>
<li><a class="external text" href="http://www.dlshq.org/download/hinduismbk.pdf" rel="nofollow">All About Hinduism by Swami Sivananda (pdf)</a> <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20191222000944/http://www.dlshq.org/download/hinduismbk.pdf" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> 22 December 2019 at the <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a>, The Divine Life Society (one of the Theistic Hindu Movements)</li>
<li><a class="external text" href="http://www.iep.utm.edu/adv-veda/" rel="nofollow">Advaita Vedanta Hinduism by Sangeetha Menon</a>, IEP (one of the non-Theistic school of Hindu philosophy)</li>
<li><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20051103040233/http://hinduism.iskcon.com/" rel="nofollow">Heart of Hinduism: An overview of Hindu traditions</a> by <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISKCON" title="ISKCON">ISKCON</a> (Hare Krishna Movement)</li>
<li><a class="external text" href="http://www.hinduismtoday.com/modules/wfchannel/index.php?wfc_cid=21" rel="nofollow">What is Hinduism?</a> <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20210418012219/https://www.hinduismtoday.com/modules/wfchannel/index.php?wfc_cid=21" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> 18 April 2021 at the <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a> by <i><a href="/wiki/Hinduism_Today" title="Hinduism Today">Hinduism Today</a></i> magazine</li></ul>

<dl><dt>Audio on Hinduism</dt></dl>
<ul><li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation cs2" id="CITEREFVivekananda1893"><a href="/wiki/Swami_Vivekananda" title="Swami Vivekananda">Vivekananda, Swami</a> (1893), <a class="external text" href="http://archive.org/details/SwamiVivekanandaSwamiVivekananda1893Speech" rel="nofollow"><i>Hinduism as religion by Swami Vivekananda 1893 Speech</i></a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/World_Parliament_of_Religions" title="World Parliament of Religions">World Parliament of Religion</a>, <a href="/wiki/Chicago" title="Chicago">Chicago</a><span class="reference-accessdate">, retrieved <span class="nowrap">17 March</span> 2021</span></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Hinduism+as+religion+by+Swami+Vivekananda+1893+Speech&amp;rft.place=World+Parliament+of+Religion%2C+Chicago&amp;rft.date=1893&amp;rft.aulast=Vivekananda&amp;rft.aufirst=Swami&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Farchive.org%2Fdetails%2FSwamiVivekanandaSwamiVivekananda1893Speech&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AHinduism"></span>.
